result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse O. Reno was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent to include Anger Managment.  No contact w/victim.  DE has 18 days jail credit if probation revoked.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: DE to serve 45 days SCJ w/huber
DE to serve 45 days conditional jail

Defendant Jesse O. Reno in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Masan states Count 1 being dismissed. Count 2: DE pleas to battery. Victim for both cases (15CM88 and 15CM301) in court, wishes to make statment. Defense has no objection to written statement previously filed and no objection to verbal statement today. Victim witness coordinator reads statement for victim. Atty Ryan makes staement.   No contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Defendant guilty.  Atty Ryan recommends 2 years probation concurrent in each case but on bail jumping, 4 mos as condition of probation be served in Sauk County Jail. Atty Masana responds. Additional jail time not necessary. Agree to probation being in place and recommends one year probation and no jail time. DE makes statement. Court imposes sentence.
Count 1:
$705 fine/costs, as condition of probation may set up a payment plan. To be paid to the Clerk of Court
18 days jail credit
Additional 45 days in Sauk County Jail 
Report to jail on or before 2/11/16 at 6:00pm 
2 years Probation
DNA sample
Undergo Anger Management and any counseling per agent
No contact with victim
Paperwork handed in court.

Return date at 09-23-2015 01:00 pm.
